column4: hello, anyone knows why: find ../ -regex "*.\(js\|xml\)$" -exec grep -i -o --color=auto sel_role {} \; -print doesn't work?Thanx
Whats happening that you think shouldn't happen?
I didn't get the right result
is it not in color, or is it not even matching the right part?
I want find 'sel_role' both in .js file and .xml file
there's no matching result
try crashanddie's suggestion
Does your find command list any js files if your remove -exec and everything after that?
let me have a try.
list a lot matching files
Are you sure that you have that line in your .js files?
Okay, does find ../ -name \*.js -exec grep -i -o --color=auto sel_role {} \; -print   show anything?
find ../ -name \*.xml -or -name \*.js -exec grep -i -o --color=auto sel_role {} \; -print CAN find sel_role in js file
yes
let me do some tests here, one moment.
I got it.
? any suggestion?
find ../ -name \*.js -or -name \*.xml -print0 |  xargs -0 grep -io --color=auto sel_role
any result from js file?
add -H to your grep command to show what file the matches are coming from.
arg... sorry: find ../ -name \*.js -or -name \*.xml | xargs grep -io --color=auto sel_role
Thanks, I got all the result (and a lot excpetions as no such file or directory)
